headline: Basic Keto Cheese Crisps
description: These cheese crisps are quick, easy, and delicious 1-ingredient ketogenic crunchy snacks for anyone on a low-carb, grain-free, or gluten-free diet.
name: Basic Keto Cheese Crisps

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper.
Arrange cheese in 24 small heaps on the prepared baking sheets.
Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, about 7 minutes. Cool for 5 to 10 minutes before removing from baking sheets.

review.reviewBody: Perfect low kcal snack or salad companion. Fresh Parmesan, one tablespoon on parchment paper, baked 400° for 7 minutes. Cooled for 5 minutes, then put in air tight container. Crisp, tasty, and so pretty. I wouldn’t use a packaged cheese and the parchment paper is important. You can use about any fresh cheese, but Park is about the lowest cal cheese there is. Bon apetite!
Perfect! So easy and no fail snack. I use Monterey Jack with nothing else.

I loved making these. So easy and taste great. The only thing I changed was I added a few sprinkles of cayenne pepper. (I like hot stuff). For those who find parchment paper expensive, I get mine at the dollar store $1.25, and you can reuse it.

I have made this with cheddar and with parmesan. With the cheddar I sprinkled a little garlic powder and chili powder on the mounds and with the parmesan I used garlic powder and celery salt. Both were wonderful and I have made them several times already. Next I am going to try parmesan with coarsely ground fresh pepper.

Tried wax paper - completely, 100% stuck. Tried greased cookie sheet, okay, but very greasy, of course. The chips became crispy upon cooking, but still too greasy. I think I will skip this recipe. If the trick is parchment paper, it is very expensive and I tend not to have it around.

Read reviews and took some of the suggeations I used the Fiesta Blend of cheeses. Opened the bag up, added some taco seasoning, closed and shacked the bag to get the seasoning mix with the cheese. Tried one tray with parchment and a second tray with aluminum foil sprayed with olive oil. Both worked well but in future will use parchment, chips less greasy. Over all easy recipe and they taste good.
new fav snack on keto diet

These are great, I found a five finger pinch (1tbs) of cheese is about right. We like the Cheddar and Monterey Jack shredded cheese mix. You can also use Mozzarella cheese. Add favorite topping including fresh herbs, red pepper flakes, jalapeño pepper slices, whatever you like. Somebody posted their’s stuck to the parchment paper, I’ve never had one stick, maybe they didn’t let them cool long enough. After cooling I move them to a paper towel to soak up residual oil.

Great recipe! I accidentally discovered “cheese crisps when I over microwaved a small batch cheese in a small microwaveable bowl. Now, rather than shredding cheese. I cup pre sliced sharp cheddar into quarters , place them in a parchment lined baking pan and bake them at 350 for 13 minutes.. Try sprinkling them with our Favorates herbs They all come out uniformly sized and snapped and are always a party favorate
Perfect just the way it’s written Thank you
Great Keto snack. Easy to make. It’s Parchment paper not wax paper. No sticking issues at all. Play with size, shape, seasoning. Enjoy. Thx.
Worth the time and effort

K so those of you that are having the issue with the sticking to the parchment paper. An important step was left out of this. You need to GREASE THE PARCHMENT PAPER (BEFORE) you put the cheese balls on it. Fixes the problem.
i like cheese
Nice crisps! Preparation was super easy! They tasted amazing! Would make again!

These are super good and super easy. I used a Mexican cheese blend and a little shredded sharp cheddar. Made my little piles and sprinkled a little parmesan and a tiny bit of garlic salt on them. Anyone who says their crisps stuck to the paper had to of been using wax paper because if you use parchment paper it absolutely will not stick.
This was so easy. Not sure why one person said they had to eat the parchment paper as it certainly did not stick to mine, and I don't see how it possibly could. Great Keto snack.
Perfect I needed something keto and quick!
Not bad; probably won’t make again. I used Medium cheddar and they were quite greasy.
Delicious! No problem sticking to the parchment paper! Nice snack. I used cheese slices and it turned out great!

Pretty good, used basic shredded 3 cheese with a sprinkle of parmesan on top.

To keep it from sticking to the parchment, use a metal spatula and gently lift it off the paper and set it back down. Just to ensure when it cools it doesn’t stick to the paper.

Just made these, they turned out perfect! Added a sprinkle of cayenne and garlic power to each one before cooking. Cooked mine a little over 7 min, they were much darker than the ones pictured, but tasted great! Lots of crunch, no burnt taste at all! For the ones saying they stick to parchment paper, you must not be using parchment paper. I tried them before with wax paper, and yes... they did stick, but mine came right off the parchment paper, no spatula needed, just picked them up with my fingers. Highly recommend!!
Loved them. Easy to make
Easy and tasty little snack. It’s not a potato chip but the nice crispy crunch is a good substitute.
The trick is to remove from parchment paper before they completely harden. They just peel off. Then let cool till they harden.
Used ungreased, non-stick cookie sheets. No need for Parchment paper. Came right off. Set on paper towels to drain a bit and stored in a paper bag to preserve crispness.
These were good but i ate too many of them and got a horrible stomach ache.
What's not to like? It's crispy cheese!!
followed recipe. worked perfectly. came right off the parchment paper. thanks!

Very simple and delicious. I used a Mexican grated cheese mix rather than cheddar, but almost any firm cheese would work I think. My wife and I broke it into pieces and used it as a garnish on a green salad.

Just made these, right out of the oven. Delicious and so easy. I plan to serve them with guacamole and salsa. Mine turned out crispy yet with a slight chewiness, which I actually like. Other chefs might want a crispier crisp. For this recipe I suggest using a finer grated cheddar as opposed to a large grate.

I've been trying to figure out how to make these for years. The best part of scrambled eggs with cheese are those little areas where the cheese gets toasted into little crisps, but trying to make them directly in the frying pan never worked out. 
Baking and parchment paper is this answer !
One note - the dryer the cheese (such as Parmesan), the less you need to bake them.
Good. 24 heaps is 2 tsp each
So so good! You can leave in longer if you want them crispier or less if you want softer. Made in a muffin tin so I wouldn't waste parchment paper and they peeled out easily enough with a spoon!
I mixed all the open packages of cheese in the refrigerator! Yummu!!!!
I had to make bigger ones since my oven is apartment size. I baked them for almost 10 minutes. I made 9 ea. with Parmesan cheese. Delish!!!!!
Great idea love to snack on these while watching tv. Thank you for sharing this easy recipe!

I have been making keto cheese chips for a while now, and what plagued me was how to keep them crisp past one or two days. Due to a happy accident I just discovered, (discovered being an over statement cause im sure someone else has done it), a solution to keeping your cheese chips crisp over time. Mine lasted 3 weeks and were as crisp as the day I made them. The secret is to use a glass baking dish, no foil or parchment, but lightly oil the bottom with your oil of choice; I use olive oil. 400 degrees like normal for 10 min depending on the thickness. My glass pan holds 8 medium size chips. The problem you have to look out for is that in my glasse pan the cheese doesn't brown so if you leave it in the oven too long beacuse you don't see it browning it will have a burnt taste.... but still crispy. Hope this helps make your experience much tastier.
Someone said it was more technique than recipe, that’s true. I made them mainly for my husband. He’s doing Keto, and I thought he’d like these cheesy bits of goodness. I
I used cheese cubes and cut them in half and i baked them to they were brown and took them out. Came out awesome!!!

I made them with imported parmesan cheese. Also sprinkled granulated garlic and black pepper on them. Soooo tasty and much cheaper then the store bought !! Definitely going to try it with a variety of other cheeses.

author.name: Sam will eat all the food

review.reviewBody: I used Parmesan cheese instead of cheddar, they were really good!
Sprinkled some with everything seasoning, yum!
Love , I sprinkled them with " bagel not included" seasoning before I put them in the oven and they were amazing
Love these. We add lots of different seasonings, garlic, season salt, pepper and/or pepper flakes
These are great, especially if you love eating cheese and parchment paper bc it is impossible to peel off. Personally I'm not much of a parchment paper snacker, I'll get my fiber elswhere.
Easy Peasy....but 7minutes for Parmesan and all the way to 8 mins for cheddar. I will make these again!
I used it for a taco shell
Loved it. Made mine in 1 cup muffin tin and they came out perfectly round. Added tuscan herbs when I took out of the oven.
Easy keto snack when you "need" something crispy. Very easy to make.
I've made this plenty of times in the last few yrs. I add seasoning before baking. I've used (oil dipping spice mixes) or I'll add a jalapeno
really satisfies !!!!
Seems like this should have been an easy one buuuuut, leave it to me to screw it up. Lol The never got crispy even after cooling. I used sharp cheddar FYI.

You can also do this with thin slices of cheese!
I buy Swiss sandwich slices, quarter them and bake for 7 min. I sprinkle some herbs or spices in too, too! Rosemary and a pinch of sea salt, chili powder or smoked paprika...the variations are endless!
Made this and I had to make two batches.. one with bacon and the other without looooove
I sprinkled lil italian seasoning on top!!
I have made this and it's yummy. it wasn't "invented" for low-carb diets, though. It's been made in northeastern Italy for centuries and is called frico.
They came out great very crispy and tasty!
It came out great. Just make sure that you set the time and allow time to cool.
Super easy! Silicon mat worked great for making this. I also tried making this with a fresh 3 cheese blend... mmmmm!

Delicious cheese crisps. Great for dipping and snacking. I use my silpat liners for these and they turn out great and crispy. I like to use a combo of multiple cheeses together also with a little italian seasoning sprinkled on top.
I just made these and they smell heavenly. Nice to know I could eat the whole two pans on keto and be fine with the diet. But of course I would not do that.
Really good! I used a mixture of shredded parmesan and mozzarella
used 3 slices of sharp cheddar, and 3 slices pepper jack (both cut into 6 equal sizes) cooked at 400 for 5 minutes
Meat needs more seasoning. Used Fiesta blend cheese. Will tweak and make again
I used shredded Mexican style blend cheese, and they turned out great!

I enjoy the store bought cheese crisps but they can be crazy expensive! These are so quick and easy to make, not to mention - a perfect snack option for those following a keto diet. I used a non-stick mini muffin pan. I noticed less is more and you really only want to put a pinch of cheese in each - no need to spray if it's a non-stick pan! Grease pooled on the top of each and I gently dumped it onto a paper towel (the crisps stayed put!) I gave it a few minutes to cool, took a spoon and pressed the edge of each and they popped right out! I put them on a paper towel to absorb a little more grease and tried to keep myself from eating them quicker than I could make them! I used a small block of sharp cheddar, grated it and that's what I used - cheap and delicious!!
These are so easy to make I love them, You can add whatever topping you want kind of like eating little pizza crisp

I've been making these for several years. You can go bigger and make taco shells in exactly the same way, just fold them into taco shapes (over a wooden spoon handle or something similar) before they cool.
Note: This recipe also works in the microwave. Depending on your microwave, it takes about 2 minutes to do a platter. But you do need to put baking paper on the microwave turntable first, otherwise they'll stick.
Baked them for only 6 min. Will do 7 next time. Used sharp cheddar, mozzarella and provolone mix, then made a 3 tray of a mix of the 2 cheeses. Turned out very nice.
Me n my family even the grandkids luved it
these are super easy to make and taste great. definitely the crunch I've been missing.
I make this with Cabot Vermont Sharp Cheddar. The flavor is most excellent. If you cook them till just the edges are brown. If you overcook, they are not dippable- they break.
These are so good! I sprinkled oregano and garlic powder on them and my house smells like pizza! I will definitely make again!
Yum!

These are super easy and super tasty. I make these to go with burgers instead of fries now, they work perfect! I like adding a little seasoning to them just as they come out of the oven.. ranch seasoning happens to be my favorite! YUM!

I liked it but next time I’ll reduce the cook time. They didn’t look done at 5 minutes so I let them go 2 more. Next time I’ll stay with 5. I’m also going to be trying other cheese besides sharp cheddar. Not a fan.

Instead of baking in the Ben I could them in stove top griddle. Easier way to manage the cook time, and I could flip them over. 
Love these! Thanks for the inspiration !

You can make these in the microwave too. I just put little piles on a paper plate a couple of inches apart because they spread a lot. Watch closely. If not done, you can put them back in. So many variations in flavors and additions, just a fun treat. They do shed a lot of grease so I put them on paper towels to absorb it. Great cheese snack, less fat.
Easy AND tasty! Great keto treat!
Delicious! I added some bacon bits and a jalapeno to each!

Basic instructions for making cheese crisps and can be used with any cheese. Mine were parmesan. DO make small cheese piles and DO wait until almost all cheese is lightly browned. I made mine large and pulled them too soon: they were still tasty but very chewy.

These came out great. Let them get brown over most of the cheese before you pull them like it says or the cheese won’t be crispy. I added salt right after I pulled them out to give them just a bit extra flavor. I would definitely recommend this for someone on Keto who is craving chips!!
YUM!

Yum! I used this recipe as a basic method for making cheese crisps but, I varied the ingredient and experimented with a few different combinations. My favorites were cheddar and thin jalapeño slices, mozzarella with minced Canadian Bacon (Just add minced pineapple and it would taste like Hawaiian pizza.), mozzarella and Parmesan with minced garlic (amazing!)

Perfect little snack. This recipe is more technique than recipe, but it works very well.

Some tips:

-Use a 24 cup muffin tin to make perfect little chips. No need to use paper if it's nonstick, or use cupcake liners.
-WEIGH the cheese, then divide by 24. Now you have even portions that cook at roughly the same time. Put a little potion cup on the scale, tier it out, then add the correct weight of cheese.
-Cook only ONE cheese at a time per pan. I found that some cheeses (harder more aged) cooked faster, while others (the mozzarella especially) took longer. Mixed pans make it impossible to time things.
-Drain on paper towel. Yes, they will be soft when you turn them out, but the added fat absorption will make them crispy and a bit less caloric. 
-Eat them soon. From past experiences with the microwave technique, I know these will only last a few days before the cheese gets 'funky' when stored at room temp. I'm not sure why, but it tends to go off fast. You could refrigerate or freeze them, but they get chewy. If that's what you're going for, have at it.
Really liked them... Thank you for sharing

I love these cheese crisps! Not only is it a great Keto snack for myself but my 10yr old daughter enjoys them as well. 

I can't wait to experiment with different types of cheese and seasonings.
Made first batch as recipe stated. They are wonderful. Now I am playing with flavors! Great recipe.
Yummy snack that is super easy to make, and is ready in about 15 minutes! I will definitely make these again, and will probably make them weekly!

I have been looking for a snack that fits with my Keto Diet... Found It! Cheese Snacks of just a few Oz. are expensive! Sure they are made with "Just Cheese" and "Artisan" Cheeses to boot, but the price is like Prime Rib Expensive!
I made one change, since I used hard/block cheese, I cut slices, then halved those, then thirded those.. so a tiny rectangle about 3/4"X 1" , it made tiny crisps, but that makes it more like a snack, and less like a meal. 
I cooked them @ 400*f for 8.5 min. any longer and they got a twinge of over doneness taste to them... any less and the centers were slightly chewy. 
I also experimented with seasonings, like Cheddar and Taco Seasoning, Mozzarella and Italian Spice, Pepper Jack Cheese(by itself), and Jack and Ranch Dressing seasoning. All were great, and only took a bit of tweaking with amounts of spice, and time in the oven. It was a fun day. With loads of snacks to show for my time!! Equivalent amount of Store Bought snacks would have been prohibitively expensive! And I had FUN! You just can't buy that kind of feeling of accomplishment. BE

Been using Asiago Cheese. I cut it in thin slices and watch it closely. 7 to 10 mins at 400 f. Make sure it's not too thick or pieces get too chewy. I usually make a larger batch and keep it in a plastic airtight container. Great Keto snack.
